parallel_specs.title: Parallel Specification Artifacts
parallel_specs.description: FileTalk specifications are maintained in two parallel forms: a machine-readable JSON specification and a human-readable Markdown specification. These documents describe the same versioned specification from complementary perspectives and are intended to coexist permanently.

purpose: Define exact message structure and constraints
Enable validation, tooling, and code generation
Serve as a stable contract for implementers
constraints: Must not contain examples requiring interpretation
Must not justify or explain design decisions

characteristics: May include diagrams, examples, and essays
May evolve independently of tooling concerns
constraints: Must not contradict the JSON specification
Must defer to JSON for all normative definitions

principle_1.name: Separation of Contract and Explanation
principle_1.statement: The JSON specification defines what is valid; the Markdown specification explains why it is defined that way. Neither document substitutes for the other.

principle_2.name: Single Source of Normative Truth
principle_2.statement: In the event of disagreement, the JSON specification is authoritative. The Markdown specification must be updated to reflect the JSON specification, never the reverse.
